reviews.review_msg: I enjoyed this class and left each lesson with steps that I could take to help better my financial future.  Mark's real-world example helped me understand complex topics.  I looked forward to his classes and felt he put a lot of effort into his lectures.

Mark did so well making our class engaged with important financial matters. It was great to hear about his stories of his experiences with money, whether it was about his fails or successes. The slides and videos he provided were also very useful. He is an all around great professor and is always happy to answer questions. Thanks, Mark!

Pretty solid professor that uses real-life scenarios to relate to in-course material which makes the class very engaging. Marks are based on weekly homework/quizzes that takes 15-20 mins to complete and is relatively easy if you are half-interested in the class. This class would be one of the few classes that I would recommend to friends.

His course on personal financial planning is both enjoyable and very useful. Pretty much each class you learn something that can be applied to improve your personal situation right away. I have an investment portfolio now, and however far it grows - that all with be thanks to Mark. Highly recommend!

Things taught will help build a solid understanding of financial situations and how to improve. 
Lectures are super interesting mixed with personal stories, he is great speaker and makes it clear he is there to help any student attending the class.

I really liked taking FASS 208 with Mark. His lectures were very engaging as he would often bring his own personal scenarios into the slides which made them much more applicable. I also liked the grading format of having 25% for each class rather than a big exam or something. Overall I would recommend taking this course with Mark :)

Mark is a great prof. Lots of real life applications of knowledge and ample opportunity to ask questions and get clarification. TA wasn't my favourite. Grading is a bit tough but I think that gets decided by the school not necessarily him. Nice to see someone who is so passionate about what he teaches. Would recommend!

Professor Ting was an amazing prof who didn't care about just finishing material but students understanding the concept. His class is very applicable to real world issues and tips that can be used in your everyday personal finance. Best professor I have had at SFU so far.
He brought a lot of real world experience into the classroom and discussed his failures and successes.  I enjoyed and took away a lot from this course.
Honest and genuine. Gives good advice and uses lots of stories/real-life examples of personal finance situations to make his point.

I wish mark made the marking more clear early on. I went for depth in my answers but when I got feedback three weeks later, I got the comment that I identified one thing, but there was 14 other point I could have mentioned. The feedback came too late as this was only a four week course. In the final week I got almost 100% which let me get a B.
